intro: Didymocarpus corniculatus, commonly known as the horned banyan, is a tropical climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, horn-like structures on its stems. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange to red berries. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a rough texture. It is often found growing in humid, shaded environments, typically in forest understories.
